   21: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   22: %%% File    : node_container_SUITE.erl
   23: %%% Author  : Rickard <rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se>
   24: %%% Purpose : 
   25: %%% Created : 24 Jul 2002 by Rickard <rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se>
   26: %%%----------------------------------------------------------------------
   27: 
   28: -module(node_container_SUITE).
   29: -author('rickard.green@uab.ericsson.se').
   30: 
   31: -include_lib("common_test/include/ct.hrl").
   32: 
   33: -export([all/0, suite/0, init_per_suite/1, end_per_suite/1,
   34:          init_per_testcase/2, end_per_testcase/2,
   35:          node_container_refc_check/1]).
   36: 
   37: -export([term_to_binary_to_term_eq/1,
   38:          round_trip_eq/1,
   39:          cmp/1,
   40:          ref_eq/1,
   41:          node_table_gc/1,
   42:          dist_link_refc/1,
   43:          dist_monitor_refc/1,
   44:          node_controller_refc/1,
   45:          ets_refc/1,
   46:          match_spec_refc/1,
   47:          timer_refc/1,
   48:          pid_wrap/1,
   49:          port_wrap/1,
   50:          bad_nc/1,
   51:          unique_pid/1,
   52:          iter_max_procs/1,
   53:          magic_ref/1,
   54:          dist_entry_gc/1,
   55:          persistent_term/1,
   56:          huge_ref/1]).
   57: 
   58: suite() ->
   59:     [{ct_hooks,[ts_install_cth]},
   60:      {timetrap, {minutes, 12}}].
   61: 
   62: 
   63: all() -> 
   64:     [dist_entry_gc, term_to_binary_to_term_eq, round_trip_eq, cmp, ref_eq,
   65:      node_table_gc, dist_link_refc, dist_monitor_refc,
   66:      node_controller_refc, ets_refc, match_spec_refc,
   67:      timer_refc, pid_wrap, port_wrap, bad_nc,
   68:      unique_pid, iter_max_procs,
   69:      magic_ref, persistent_term, huge_ref].
   70: 
   71: init_per_suite(Config) ->
   72:     Config.
   73: 
   74: end_per_suite(_Config) ->
   75:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
   76:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
   77:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(false).
   78: 
   79: init_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   80:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(true),
   81:     Config.
   82: 
   83: end_per_testcase(_Case, Config) when is_list(Config) ->
   84:     erts_test_utils:ept_check_leaked_nodes(Config).
   85: 
   86: %%%
   87: %%% The test cases -------------------------------------------------------------
   88: %%%
   89: 
   90: max_internal_pids_ports() ->
   91:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
   92:         8 -> (1 bsl 60) - 1;
   93:         4 -> (1 bsl 28) - 1
   94:     end.
   95: 
   96: max_pids_ports() ->
   97:     (1 bsl 64) - 1.
   98: 
   99: max_old_pids_ports() ->
  100:     (1 bsl 28) - 1.
  101: 
  102: max_internal_pid_num() ->
  103:     (1 bsl 28) - 1.
  104: 
  105: max_internal_pid_ser() ->
  106:     case erlang:system_info(wordsize) of
  107:         8 -> (1 bsl 32) - 1;
  108:         4 -> 0
  109:     end.
  110: 
  111: max_pid_num() ->
  112:     (1 bsl 32) - 1.
  113: 
  114: max_pid_ser() ->
  115:     (1 bsl 32) - 1.
  116: 
  117: max_old_pid_num() ->
  118:     (1 bsl 15) - 1.
  119: 
  120: max_old_pid_ser() ->
  121:     (1 bsl 13) - 1.
  122: 
  123: %%
  124: %% Test case: term_to_binary_to_term_eq
  125: %%
  126: %% Tests that node container terms that are converted to external format
  127: %% and back stay equal to themselves.
  128: term_to_binary_to_term_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  129:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  130:     % Get local node containers
  131:     LPid = self(),
  132:     LXPid = mk_pid(ThisNode, 0, max_internal_pid_ser()),
  133:     LX2Pid = mk_pid(ThisNode, max_internal_pid_num() - 4711, max_internal_pid_ser()),
  134:     LPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  135:     LXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435455),
  136:     LX2Port = mk_port(ThisNode, max_internal_pids_ports() - 4711),
  137:     LLRef = make_ref(),
  138:     LHLRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [47, 11]),
  139:     LSRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  140:     % Test local nc:s
  141:     LPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LPid)),
  142:     LXPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LXPid)),
  143:     LX2Pid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LX2Pid)),
  144:     LPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LPort)),
  145:     LXPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LXPort)),
  146:     LX2Port = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LX2Port)),
  147:     LLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LLRef)),
  148:     LHLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LHLRef)),
  149:     LSRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(LSRef)),
  150:     % Get remote node containers
  151:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 3}),
  152:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 4}),
  153:     ttbtteq_do_remote({get_nodename(), 16#adec0ded}),
  154:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  155:     ok.
  156: 
  157: ttbtteq_do_remote(RNode) ->
  158:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 1),
  159:     RXPid = mk_pid(RNode, 32767, 8191),
  160:     RXPid2 = mk_pid(RNode, max_pid_num(), max_pid_ser()),
  161:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  162:     RXPort = mk_port(RNode, 268435455),
  163:     RXPort2 = case RNode of
  164: 		  {_, C} when C < 4 ->
  165: 		      mk_port(RNode, 4711);
  166: 		  _ ->
  167: 		      mk_port(RNode, (1 bsl 51) + 4711)
  168: 	      end,
  169:     RXPort3 = mk_port(RNode, max_pids_ports()),
  170:     RLRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 4711, 4711]),
  171:     RHLRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 4711]),
  172:     RSRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711]),
  173:     % Test remote nc:s
  174:     RPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RPid)),
  175:     RXPid = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPid)),
  176:     RXPid2 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPid2)),
  177:     RPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RPort)),
  178:     RXPort = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort)),
  179:     RXPort2 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort2)),
  180:     RXPort3 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RXPort3)),
  181:     RLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RLRef)),
  182:     RHLRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RHLRef)),
  183:     RSRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(RSRef)),
  184:     ok.
  185: 
  186: 
  187: %%
  188: %% Test case: round_trip_eq
  189: %%
  190: %% Tests that node containers that are sent between nodes stay equal to themselves.
  191: round_trip_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  192:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  193:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  194:     Self = self(),
  195:     RPid = spawn_link(Node,
  196:                       fun () ->
  197:                               receive
  198:                                   {Self, Data} ->
  199:                                       Self ! {self(), Data}
  200:                               end
  201:                       end),
  202:     SentPid = self(),
  203:     SentXPid = mk_pid(ThisNode, 17471, max_internal_pid_ser()),
  204:     SentXPid2 = mk_pid(ThisNode, max_internal_pid_num(), max_internal_pid_ser()),
  205:     SentXPid3 = mk_pid({Node, 4711}, 4711, 17),
  206:     SentXPid4 = mk_pid({Node, 4711}, max_pid_num(), max_pid_ser()),
  207:     SentPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  208:     SentXPort = mk_port(ThisNode, 268435451),
  209:     SentXPort2 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, (1 bsl 49) + 4711),
  210:     SentXPort2 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, (1 bsl 49) + 4711),
  211:     SentXPort3 = mk_port(ThisNode, max_internal_pids_ports()),
  212:     SentXPort4 = mk_port({Node, 4711}, max_pids_ports()),
  213:     SentLRef = make_ref(),
  214:     SentHLRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 17]),
  215:     SentSRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  216:     RPid ! {Self, {SentPid,
  217:                    SentXPid,
  218:                    SentXPid2,
  219:                    SentXPid3,
  220:                    SentXPid4,
  221:                    SentPort,
  222:                    SentXPort,
  223:                    SentXPort2,
  224:                    SentXPort3,
  225:                    SentXPort4,
  226:                    SentLRef,
  227:                    SentHLRef,
  228:                    SentSRef}},
  229:     receive
  230:         {RPid, {RecPid,
  231:                 RecXPid,
  232:                 RecXPid2,
  233:                 RecXPid3,
  234:                 RecXPid4,
  235:                 RecPort,
  236:                 RecXPort,
  237:                 RecXPort2,
  238:                 RecXPort3,
  239:                 RecXPort4,
  240:                 RecLRef,
  241:                 RecHLRef,
  242:                 RecSRef}} ->
  243:             stop_node(Peer, Node),
  244:             SentPid = RecPid,
  245:             SentXPid = RecXPid,
  246:             SentXPid2 = RecXPid2,
  247:             SentXPid3 = RecXPid3,
  248:             SentXPid4 = RecXPid4,
  249:             SentPort = RecPort,
  250:             SentXPort = RecXPort,
  251:             SentXPort2 = RecXPort2,
  252:             SentXPort3 = RecXPort3,
  253:             SentXPort4 = RecXPort4,
  254:             SentLRef = RecLRef,
  255:             SentHLRef = RecHLRef,
  256:             SentSRef = RecSRef,
  257:             nc_refc_check(node()),
  258:             ok
  259:     end.
  260: 
  261: 
  262: 
  263: %%
  264: %% Test case: cmp
  265: %%
  266: %% Tests that Erlang term comparison works as it should on node containers.
  267: cmp(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  268: 
  269:     %% Inter type comparison ---------------------------------------------------
  270: 
  271:     %% The Erlang term order:
  272:     %% number < atom < ref < fun < port < pid < tuple < nil < cons < binary
  273:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 2},
  274: 
  275:     IRef = make_ref(),
  276:     ERef = mk_ref({get_nodename(), 2}, [1,2,3]),
  277: 
  278:     IPid = self(),
  279:     EPid = mk_pid(RNode, 1, 2),
  280: 
  281:     IPort = hd(erlang:ports()),
  282:     EPort = mk_port(RNode, 1),
  283: 
  284:     %% Test pids ----------------------------------------------------
  285:     true = 1 < IPid,
  286:     true = 1.3 < IPid,
  287:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IPid,
  288:     true = an_atom < IPid,
  289:     true = IRef < IPid,
  290:     true = ERef < IPid,
  291:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < IPid,
  292:     true = IPort < IPid,
  293:     true = EPort < IPid,
  294:     true = IPid < {a, tuple},
  295:     true = IPid < [],
  296:     true = IPid < [a|cons],
  297:     true = IPid < <<"a binary">>,
  298: 
  299:     true = 1 < EPid,
  300:     true = 1.3 < EPid,
  301:     true = (1 bsl 64) < EPid,
  302:     true = an_atom < EPid,
  303:     true = IRef < EPid,
  304:     true = ERef < EPid,
  305:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < EPid,
  306:     true = IPort < EPid,
  307:     true = EPort < EPid,
  308:     true = EPid < {a, tuple},
  309:     true = EPid < [],
  310:     true = EPid < [a|cons],
  311:     true = EPid < <<"a binary">>,
  312: 
  313:     %% Test ports --------------------------------------------------
  314:     true = 1 < IPort,
  315:     true = 1.3 < IPort,
  316:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IPort,
  317:     true = an_atom < IPort,
  318:     true = IRef < IPort,
  319:     true = ERef < IPort,
  320:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < IPort,
  321:     true = IPort < IPid,
  322:     true = IPort < EPid,
  323:     true = IPort < {a, tuple},
  324:     true = IPort < [],
  325:     true = IPort < [a|cons],
  326:     true = IPort < <<"a binary">>,
  327: 
  328:     true = 1 < EPort,
  329:     true = 1.3 < EPort,
  330:     true = (1 bsl 64) < EPort,
  331:     true = an_atom < EPort,
  332:     true = IRef < EPort,
  333:     true = ERef < EPort,
  334:     true = fun () -> a_fun end < EPort,
  335:     true = EPort < IPid,
  336:     true = EPort < EPid,
  337:     true = EPort < {a, tuple},
  338:     true = EPort < [],
  339:     true = EPort < [a|cons],
  340:     true = EPort < <<"a binary">>,
  341: 
  342:     %% Test refs ----------------------------------------------------
  343:     true = 1 < IRef,
  344:     true = 1.3 < IRef,
  345:     true = (1 bsl 64) < IRef,
  346:     true = an_atom < IRef,
  347:     true = IRef < fun () -> a_fun end,
  348:     true = IRef < IPort,
  349:     true = IRef < EPort,
  350:     true = IRef < IPid,
  351:     true = IRef < EPid,
  352:     true = IRef < {a, tuple},
  353:     true = IRef < [],
  354:     true = IRef < [a|cons],
  355:     true = IRef < <<"a binary">>,
  356: 
  357:     true = 1 < ERef,
  358:     true = 1.3 < ERef,
  359:     true = (1 bsl 64) < ERef,
  360:     true = an_atom < ERef,
  361:     true = ERef < fun () -> a_fun end,
  362:     true = ERef < IPort,
  363:     true = ERef < EPort,
  364:     true = ERef < IPid,
  365:     true = ERef < EPid,
  366:     true = ERef < {a, tuple},
  367:     true = ERef < [],
  368:     true = ERef < [a|cons],
  369:     true = ERef < <<"a binary">>,
  370: 
  371: 
  372:     %% Intra type comparison ---------------------------------------------------
  373: 
  374: 
  375:     %% Test pids ----------------------------------------------------
  376:     %%
  377:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  378:     %%   serial, number, nodename, creation
  379:     %%
  380: 
  381:     Pid = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 1),
  382: 
  383:     true = mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, 2) > Pid,
  384:     true = mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4712, 1) > Pid,
  385:     true = mk_pid({c@b, 1}, 4711, 1) > Pid,
  386:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 3}, 4711, 1) > Pid,
  387:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 1) =:= Pid,
  388: 
  389:     %% Test big external pids (> OTP-24)
  390:     MaxPidNum = max_old_pid_num(),
  391:     MaxPidSer = max_old_pid_ser(),
  392:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, MaxPidSer+1),
  393:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, (1 bsl 31)),
  394:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, MaxPidSer) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, 4710, (1 bsl 32)-1),
  395: 
  396:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, MaxPidNum+1, 17),
  397:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, (1 bsl 31), 17),
  398:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, MaxPidNum, 17) < mk_pid({a@b, 1}, (1 bsl 32)-1, 17),
  399: 
  400:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, 4}, 4711, 17),
  401:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, (1 bsl 31)}, 4711, 17),
  402:     true = mk_pid({b@b, 2}, 4711, 17) < mk_pid({b@b, (1 bsl 32)-1}, 4711, 17),
  403: 
  404: 
  405:     %% Test ports ---------------------------------------------------
  406:     %%
  407:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  408:     %%   nodename, creation, number 
  409:     %%
  410:     %% OBS: Comparison between ports has changed in R9. This
  411:     %%      since it wasn't stable in R8 (and eariler releases).
  412:     %%      Significance used to be: dist_slot, number,
  413:     %%      creation.
  414: 
  415:     Port = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4711),
  416: 
  417:     true = mk_port({c@b, 1}, 4710) > Port,
  418:     true = mk_port({b@b, 3}, 4710) > Port,
  419:     true = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4712) > Port,
  420:     true = mk_port({b@b, 2}, 4711) =:= Port,
  421: 
  422:     %% Test refs ----------------------------------------------------
  423:     %% Significance (most -> least):
  424:     %% nodename, creation, (number high, number mid), number low, 
  425:     %%
  426:     %% OBS: Comparison between refs has changed in R9. This
  427:     %%      since it wasn't stable in R8 (and eariler releases).
  428:     %%      Significance used to be: dist_slot, number,
  429:     %%      creation.
  430:     %%
  431: 
  432:     Ref = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4711, 4711, 4711]),
  433: 
  434:     true = mk_ref({c@b, 1}, [4710, 4710, 4710]) > Ref,
  435:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 3}, [4710, 4710, 4710]) > Ref,
  436:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4710, 4710, 4712]) > Ref,
  437:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4710, 4712, 4711]) > Ref,
  438:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4712, 4711, 4711]) > Ref,
  439:     true = mk_ref({b@b, 2}, [4711, 4711, 4711]) =:= Ref,
  440: 
  441:     ok.
  442: 
  443: %%
  444: %% Test case: ref_eq
  445: %%
  446: %% Test that one word refs works
  447: ref_eq(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  448:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  449:     AnotherNode = {get_nodename(),2},
  450:     LLongRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0, 0]),
  451:     LHalfLongRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0]),
  452:     LShortRef = mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711]),
  453:     true = LLongRef =:= LShortRef,
  454:     true = LLongRef =:= LHalfLongRef,
  455:     true = LLongRef =:= LLongRef,
  456:     true = LHalfLongRef =:= LShortRef,
  457:     true = LHalfLongRef =:= LHalfLongRef,
  458:     true = LShortRef =:= LShortRef,
  459:     false = LShortRef == mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 0, 1]), % Not any more
  460:     RLongRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0, 0]),
  461:     RHalfLongRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0]),
  462:     RShortRef = mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711]),
  463:     true = RLongRef =:= RShortRef,
  464:     true = RLongRef =:= RHalfLongRef,
  465:     true = RLongRef =:= RLongRef,
  466:     true = RHalfLongRef =:= RShortRef,
  467:     true = RHalfLongRef =:= RHalfLongRef,
  468:     true = RShortRef =:= RShortRef,
  469:     false = RShortRef == mk_ref(AnotherNode, [4711, 0, 1]), % Not any more
  470:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  471:     ok.
  472: 
  473: %%
  474: %% Test case: node_table_gc
  475: %%
  476: %% Tests that node tables are garbage collected.
  477: node_table_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  478:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  479:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, 0),
  480:     PreKnown = nodes(known),
  481:     io:format("PreKnown = ~p~n", [PreKnown]),
  482:     make_node_garbage(0, 200000, 1000, []),
  483:     receive after 1000 -> ok end, %% Wait for thread progress...
  484:     PostKnown = nodes(known),
  485:     PostAreas = erlang:system_info(allocated_areas),
  486:     io:format("PostKnown = ~p~n", [PostKnown]),
  487:     io:format("PostAreas = ~p~n", [PostAreas]),
  488:     true = length(PostKnown) =< length(PreKnown),
  489:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  490:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
  491:     ok.
  492: 
  493: make_node_garbage(N, L, I, Ps) when N < L ->
  494:     Self = self(),
  495:     P = spawn_link(fun () ->
  496:                            % Generate two node entries and one dist
  497:                            % entry per node name
  498:                            PL1 = make_faked_pid_list(N,
  499:                                                      I div 2,
  500:                                                      1),
  501:                            put(a, PL1),
  502:                            PL2 = make_faked_pid_list(N,
  503:                                                      I div 2,
  504:                                                      2),
  505:                            put(b, PL2),
  506:                            Self ! {self(), length(nodes(known))}
  507:                    end),
  508:     receive
  509:         {P, KnownLength} ->
  510:             true = KnownLength >= I div 2
  511:     end,
  512:     make_node_garbage(N+(I div 2)*2, L, I, [P|Ps]);
  513: make_node_garbage(_, _, _, Ps) ->
  514:     %% Cleanup garbage...
  515:     ProcIsCleanedUp
  516:     = fun (Proc) ->
  517:               undefined == erts_debug:get_internal_state({process_status,
  518:                                                           Proc})
  519:       end,
  520:     lists:foreach(fun (P) -> wait_until(fun () -> ProcIsCleanedUp(P) end) end,
  521:                   Ps),
  522:     ok.
  523: 
  524: 
  525: make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation) ->
  526:     make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation, []).
  527: 
  528: make_faked_pid_list(_Start, 0, _Creation, Acc) ->
  529:     Acc;
  530: make_faked_pid_list(Start, No, Creation, Acc) ->
  531:     make_faked_pid_list(Start+1,
  532:                         No-1,
  533:                         Creation,
  534:                         [mk_pid({"faked_node-"
  535:                                  ++ integer_to_list(Start rem 50000)
  536:                                  ++ "@"
  537:                                  ++ atom_to_list(?MODULE),
  538:                                  Creation},
  539:                                 4711,
  540:                                 3) | Acc]).
  541: 
  542: %%
  543: %% Test case: dist_link_refc
  544: %%
  545: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  546: %% as they should for distributed links
  547: dist_link_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  548:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  549:     RP = spawn_execer(Node),
  550:     LP = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  551:     true = sync_exec(RP, fun () -> link(LP) end),
  552:     wait_until(fun () ->
  553:                        {links, Links} = process_info(LP, links),
  554:                        lists:member(RP, Links)
  555:                end),
  556:     NodeCre = sync_exec(RP, fun() -> erlang:system_info(creation) end),
  557:     1 = reference_type_count(
  558:           link,
  559:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  560:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  561:     exec(RP, fun() -> exit(normal) end),
  562:     wait_until(fun () ->
  563:                        {links, Links} = process_info(LP, links),
  564:                        not lists:member(RP, Links)
  565:                end),
  566:     0 = reference_type_count(
  567:           link,
  568:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  569:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  570:     exit(LP, normal),
  571:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  572:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  573:     ok.
  574: 
  575: 
  576: %%
  577: %% Test case: dist_monitor_refc
  578: %%
  579: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  580: %% as they should for distributed monitors
  581: dist_monitor_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  582:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  583:     RP = spawn_execer(Node),
  584:     LP = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  585:     RMon = sync_exec(RP, fun () -> erlang:monitor(process, LP) end),
  586:     true = is_reference(RMon),
  587:     LMon = sync_exec(LP, fun () -> erlang:monitor(process, RP) end),
  588:     true = is_reference(LMon),
  589:     NodeCre = sync_exec(RP, fun() -> erlang:system_info(creation) end),
  590:     wait_until(fun () ->
  591:                        {monitored_by, MonBy}
  592:                        = process_info(LP, monitored_by),
  593:                        {monitors, Mon}
  594:                        = process_info(LP, monitors),
  595:                        (lists:member(RP, MonBy)
  596:                         and lists:member({process,RP}, Mon))
  597:                end),
  598:     3 = reference_type_count(
  599:           monitor,
  600:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  601:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  602:     exec(RP, fun () -> exit(normal) end),
  603:     wait_until(fun () ->
  604:                        {monitored_by, MonBy}
  605:                        = process_info(LP, monitored_by),
  606:                        {monitors, Mon}
  607:                        = process_info(LP, monitors),
  608:                        ((not lists:member(RP, MonBy))
  609:                         and (not lists:member({process,RP}, Mon)))
  610:                end),
  611:     ok = sync_exec(LP,
  612:                    fun () ->
  613:                            receive
  614:                                {'DOWN', LMon, process, _, _} ->
  615:                                    ok
  616:                            end
  617:                    end),
  618:     0 = reference_type_count(
  619:           link,
  620:           refering_entity_id({process, LP},
  621:                              get_node_references({Node, NodeCre}))),
  622:     exit(LP, normal),
  623:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  624:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  625:     ok.
  626: 
  627: 
  628: %%
  629: %% Test case: node_controller_refc
  630: %%
  631: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  632: %% as they should for entities controlling a connections.
  633: node_controller_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  634:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(available_internal_state, true),
  635:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, 0),
  636:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
  637:     true = lists:member(Node, nodes()),
  638:     1 = reference_type_count(control, get_dist_references(Node)),
  639:     P = spawn_link_execer(node()),
  640:     Node
  641:     = sync_exec(P,
  642:                 fun () ->
  643:                         put(remote_net_kernel,
  644:                             rpc:call(Node,erlang,whereis,[net_kernel])),
  645:                         node(get(remote_net_kernel))
  646:                 end),
  647:     Creation = rpc:call(Node, erlang, system_info, [creation]),
  648:     monitor_node(Node,true),
  649:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
  650:     receive {nodedown, Node} -> ok end,
  651:     DistRefs = get_dist_references(Node),
  652:     true = reference_type_count(node, DistRefs) > 0,
  653:     0 = reference_type_count(control, DistRefs),
  654:     % Get rid of all references to Node
  655:     exec(P, fun () -> exit(normal) end),
  656:     wait_until(fun () -> not is_process_alive(P) end),
  657:     lists:foreach(fun (Proc) -> garbage_collect(Proc) end, processes()),
  658:     false = get_node_references({Node,Creation}),
  659:     wait_until(fun () ->
  660:                        case get_dist_references(Node) of
  661:                            false ->
  662:                                true;
  663:                            [{{system,thread_progress_delete_timer},
  664:                              [{system,1}]}] ->
  665:                                false;
  666:                            Other ->
  667:                                ct:fail(Other)
  668:                        end
  669:                end),
  670:     false = lists:member(Node, nodes(known)),
  671:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  672:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(node_tab_delayed_delete, -1), %% restore original value
  673:     ok.
  674: 
  675: %%
  676: %% Test case: ets_refc
  677: %%
  678: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  679: %% as they should for data stored in ets tables.
  680: ets_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  681:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  682:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  683:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  684:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  685:     Tab = ets:new(ets_refc, []),
  686:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  687:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{a, self()},
  688:                             {b, RPid},
  689:                             {c, hd(erlang:ports())},
  690:                             {d, RPort},
  691:                             {e, make_ref()}]),
  692:     2 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  693:     true = ets:insert(Tab, {f, RRef}),
  694:     3 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  695:     true = ets:delete(Tab, d),
  696:     2 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  697:     true = ets:delete_all_objects(Tab),
  698:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  699:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{b, RPid}, {e, make_ref()}]),
  700:     1 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  701:     true = ets:delete(Tab),
  702:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, get_node_references(RNode)),
  703:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  704:     ok.
  705: 
  706: %%
  707: %% Test case: match_spec_refc
  708: %%
  709: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  710: %% as they should for data stored in match specifications.
  711: match_spec_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  712:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  713:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  714:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  715:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  716:     ok = do_match_spec_test(RNode, RPid, RPort, RRef),
  717:     garbage_collect(),
  718:     NodeRefs = get_node_references(RNode),
  719:     0 = reference_type_count(binary, NodeRefs),
  720:     0 = reference_type_count(ets, NodeRefs),
  721:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  722:     ok.
  723: 
  724: do_match_spec_test(RNode, RPid, RPort, RRef) ->
  725:     Tab = ets:new(match_spec_refc, []),
  726:     true = ets:insert(Tab, [{a, RPid, RPort, RRef},
  727:                             {b, self(), RPort, RRef},
  728:                             {c, RPid, RPort, make_ref()},
  729:                             {d, RPid, RPort, RRef}]),
  730:     {M1, C1} = ets:select(Tab, [{{'$1',RPid,RPort,RRef},[],['$1']}], 1),
  731:     NodeRefs = get_node_references(RNode),
  732:     3 = reference_type_count(binary, NodeRefs),
  733:     10 = reference_type_count(ets, NodeRefs),
  734:     {M2, C2} = ets:select(C1),
  735:     '$end_of_table' = ets:select(C2),
  736:     ets:delete(Tab),
  737:     [a,d] = lists:sort(M1++M2),
  738:     ok.
  739: 
  740: 
  741: %%
  742: %% Test case: ets_refc
  743: %%
  744: %% Tests that external reference counts are incremented and decremented
  745: %% as they should for data stored in bif timers.
  746: timer_refc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  747:     RNode = {get_nodename(), 1},
  748:     RPid = mk_pid(RNode, 4711, 2),
  749:     RPort = mk_port(RNode, 4711),
  750:     RRef = mk_ref(RNode, [4711, 47, 11]),
  751:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  752:     Pid = spawn(fun () -> receive after infinity -> ok end end),
  753:     erlang:start_timer(10000, Pid, {RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  754:     3 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  755:     exit(Pid, kill),
  756:     Mon = erlang:monitor(process, Pid),
  757:     receive {'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} -> ok end,
  758:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  759:     erlang:send_after(500, Pid, {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  760:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  761:     erlang:send_after(500, self(), {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  762:     erlang:send_after(400, bananfluga, {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef}),
  763:     6 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  764:     receive {timer, RPid, RPort, RRef} -> ok end,
  765:     0 = reference_type_count(timer, get_node_references(RNode)),
  766:     nc_refc_check(node()),
  767:     ok.
  768: 
  769: pid_wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) -> pp_wrap(pid).
  770: 
  771: port_wrap(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  772:     case os:type() of
  773:         {unix, _} ->
  774:             pp_wrap(port);
  775:         _ ->
  776:             {skip, "Only run on unix"}
  777:     end.
  778: 
  779: get_next_id(pid) ->
  780:     erts_debug:get_internal_state(next_pid);
  781: get_next_id(port) ->
  782:     erts_debug:get_internal_state(next_port).
  783: 
  784: set_next_id(pid, N) ->
  785:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_pid, N);
  786: set_next_id(port, N) ->
  787:     erts_debug:set_internal_state(next_port, N).
  788: 
  789: pp_wrap(What) ->
  790:     N = set_high_pp_next(What),
  791:     Cre = N + 100,
  792:     io:format("no creations = ~p~n", [Cre]),
  793:     PreCre = get_next_id(What),
  794:     io:format("pre creations = ~p~n", [PreCre]),
  795:     true = is_integer(PreCre),
  796:     do_pp_creations(What, Cre),
  797:     PostCre = get_next_id(What),
  798:     io:format("post creations = ~p~n", [PostCre]),
  799:     true = is_integer(PostCre),
  800:     true = PreCre > PostCre,
  801:     Now = set_next_id(What, max_internal_pids_ports() div 2),
  802:     io:format("reset to = ~p~n", [Now]),
  803:     true = is_integer(Now),
  804:     ok.
  805: 
  806: set_high_pp_next(What) ->
  807:     set_high_pp_next(What, max_internal_pids_ports()-1).
  808: 
  809: set_high_pp_next(What, N) ->
  810:     M = set_next_id(What, N),
  811:     true = is_integer(M),
  812:     case {M >= N, M =< max_internal_pids_ports()} of
  813:         {true, true} ->
  814:             max_internal_pids_ports() - M + 1;
  815:         _ ->
  816:             set_high_pp_next(What, N - 100)
  817:     end.
  818: 
  819: do_pp_creations(_What, N) when is_integer(N), N =< 0 ->
  820:     done;
  821: do_pp_creations(pid, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  822:     %% Create new pid and make sure it works...
  823:     Me = self(),
  824:     Ref = make_ref(),
  825:     Pid = spawn_link(fun () ->
  826:                              receive
  827:                                  Ref ->
  828:                                      Me ! Ref
  829:                              end
  830:                      end),
  831:     Pid ! Ref,
  832:     receive
  833:         Ref ->
  834:             do_pp_creations(pid, N - 1)
  835:     end;
  836: do_pp_creations(port, N) when is_integer(N) ->
  837:     %% Create new port and make sure it works...
  838:     "hej" = os:cmd("echo hej") -- "\n",
  839:     do_pp_creations(port, N - 1).
  840: 
  841: bad_nc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  842:     % Make sure emulator don't crash on bad node containers...
  843:     ThisNode = {node(), erlang:system_info(creation)},
  844:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  845:     = (catch mk_pid(ThisNode, max_internal_pid_num() + 1, 17)),
  846:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  847:     = (catch mk_pid(ThisNode, 4711, max_internal_pid_ser() + 1)),
  848:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  849:     = (catch mk_port(ThisNode, max_internal_pids_ports() + 1)),
  850:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  851:     = (catch mk_ref(ThisNode,[(1 bsl 18), 4711, 4711])),
  852:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  853:     = (catch mk_ref(ThisNode, [4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711])),
  854:     RemNode = {x@y, 2},
  855:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  856:     = (catch mk_pid(RemNode, max_pid_num() + 1, 17)),
  857:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  858:     = (catch mk_pid(RemNode, 4711, max_pid_ser() + 1)),
  859:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  860:     = (catch mk_port(RemNode, max_pids_ports() + 1)),
  861:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  862:     = (catch mk_ref(RemNode, [(1 bsl 18), 4711, 4711])),
  863:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  864:     = (catch mk_ref(RemNode, [4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711, 4711])),
  865:     BadNode = {x@y, bad_creation},
  866:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_pid, _}}
  867:     = (catch mk_pid(BadNode, 4711, 17)),
  868:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_port, _}}
  869:     = (catch mk_port(BadNode, 4711)),
  870:     {'EXIT', {badarg, mk_ref, _}}
  871:     = (catch mk_ref(BadNode, [4711, 4711, 17])),
  872: 
  873: 
  874:     %% OTP 24:
  875:     mk_port({x@y, 4}, max_old_pids_ports() + 1),
  876:     mk_port({x@y, 4}, max_pids_ports()),
  877: 
  878:     %% OTP 24: External pids can use 32+32 bits
  879:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_old_pid_num() + 1, max_old_pid_ser()),
  880:     mk_pid(RemNode, (1 bsl 32)-1, max_old_pid_ser()),
  881:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_old_pid_num(), max_old_pid_ser() + 1),
  882:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_old_pid_num(), (1 bsl 32)-1),
  883:     mk_pid(RemNode, max_pid_num(), max_pid_ser()),
  884:     ok.
  885: 
  886: 
  887: 
  888: -define(NO_PIDS, 1000000).
  889: 
  890: unique_pid(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  891:     case catch erlang:system_info(modified_timing_level) of
  892:         Level when is_integer(Level) ->
  893:             {skip,
  894:              "Modified timing (level " ++ integer_to_list(Level)
  895:              ++ ") is enabled. spawn() is too slow for this "
  896:              " test when modified timing is enabled."};
  897:         _ ->
  898:             ?NO_PIDS = length(lists:usort(mkpidlist(?NO_PIDS, []))),
  899:             ok
  900:     end.
  901: 
  902: mkpidlist(0, Ps) -> Ps;
  903: mkpidlist(N, Ps) -> mkpidlist(N-1, [spawn(fun () -> ok end)|Ps]).
  904: 
  905: 
  906: iter_max_procs(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  907:     NoMoreTests = make_ref(),
  908:     erlang:send_after(10000, self(), NoMoreTests),
  909: 
  910:     %% Disable logging to avoid "Too many processes" log which can
  911:     %% cause ct_logs to crash when trying to spawn "async print job".
  912:     #{level := LoggerLevel} = logger:get_primary_config(),
  913:     ok = logger:set_primary_config(level, none),
  914:     Res = try
  915:               R = chk_max_proc_line(),
  916:               R = chk_max_proc_line(),
  917:               done = chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, R),
  918:               R
  919:           after
  920:               logger:set_primary_config(level, LoggerLevel)
  921:           end,
  922:     Cmt = io_lib:format("max processes = ~p; "
  923:                         "process line length = ~p",
  924:                         [element(2, Res), element(1, Res)]),
  925:     {comment, lists:flatten(Cmt)}.
  926: 
  927: max_proc_line(Root, Parent, N) ->
  928:     Me = self(),
  929:     case catch spawn_link(fun () -> max_proc_line(Root, Me, N+1) end) of
  930:         {'EXIT', {system_limit, _}} when Root /= self() ->
  931:             Root ! {proc_line_length, N, self()},
  932:             receive remove_proc_line -> Parent ! {exiting, Me} end;
  933:         P when is_pid(P), Root =/= self() ->
  934:             receive {exiting, P} -> Parent ! {exiting, Me} end;
  935:         P when is_pid(P) ->
  936:             P;
  937:         Unexpected ->
  938:             exit({unexpected_spawn_result, Unexpected})
  939:     end.
  940: 
  941: chk_max_proc_line() ->
  942:     Child = max_proc_line(self(), self(), 0),
  943:     receive
  944:         {proc_line_length, PLL, End} ->
  945:             PC = erlang:system_info(process_count),
  946:             LP = length(processes()),
  947:             io:format("proc line length = ~p; "
  948:                       "process count = ~p; "
  949:                       "length processes = ~p~n",
  950:                       [PLL, PC, LP]),
  951:                   End ! remove_proc_line,
  952:                   PC = LP,
  953:                   receive {exiting, Child} -> ok end,
  954:                   {PLL, PC}
  955:     end.
  956: 
  957: chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, Res) ->
  958:     receive
  959:         NoMoreTests ->
  960:             done
  961:     after 0 ->
  962:               Res = chk_max_proc_line(),
  963:               chk_max_proc_line_until(NoMoreTests, Res)
  964:     end.
  965: 
  966: magic_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
  967:     {MRef0, Addr0} = erts_debug:set_internal_state(make, magic_ref),
  968:     true = is_reference(MRef0),
  969:     {Addr0, 1, true} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef0}),
  970:     MRef1 = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(MRef0)),
  971:     {Addr0, 2, true} = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef1}),
  972:     MRef0 = MRef1,
  973:     Me = self(),
  974:     {Pid, Mon} = spawn_opt(fun () ->
  975: 				   receive
  976: 				       {Me, MRef} ->
  977: 					   Me ! {self(), erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef})}
  978: 				   end
  979: 			   end,
  980: 			   [link, monitor]),
  981:     Pid ! {self(), MRef0},
  982:     receive
  983: 	{Pid, Info} ->
  984: 	    {Addr0, 3, true} = Info
  985:     end,
  986:     receive
  987: 	{'DOWN', Mon, process, Pid, _} ->
  988: 	    ok
  989:     end,
  990:     MaxTime = erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond) + 1000,
  991:     %% The DOWN signal is sent before heap is cleaned up,
  992:     %% so we might need to wait some time after the DOWN
  993:     %% signal has been received before the heap actually
  994:     %% has been cleaned up...
  995:     wait_until(fun () ->
  996:                        case erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef0}) of
  997:                            {Addr0, 2, true} ->
  998:                                true;
  999:                            {Addr0, 3, true} ->
 1000:                                true = MaxTime >= erlang:monotonic_time(millisecond),
 1001:                                false;
 1002:                            Error ->
 1003:                                ct:fail(Error)
 1004:                        end
 1005:                end),
 1006:     id(MRef0),
 1007:     id(MRef1),
 1008:     MRefExt = term_to_binary(erts_debug:set_internal_state(make, magic_ref)),
 1009:     garbage_collect(),
 1010:     {MRef2, _Addr2} = binary_to_term(MRefExt),
 1011:     true = is_reference(MRef2),
 1012:     true = erts_debug:get_internal_state({magic_ref,MRef2}),
 1013:     ok.
 1014: 
 1015: persistent_term(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1016:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1017:     Self = self(),
 1018:     NcData = make_ref(),
 1019:     RPid = spawn_link(Node,
 1020:                       fun () ->
 1021:                               Self ! {NcData, self(), hd(erlang:ports()), erlang:make_ref()}
 1022:                       end),
 1023:     Data = receive
 1024:                {NcData, RPid, RPort, RRef} ->
 1025:                    {RPid, RPort, RRef}
 1026:            end,
 1027:     unlink(RPid),
 1028:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1029:     Stuff = lists:foldl(fun (N, Acc) ->
 1030:                                 persistent_term:put({?MODULE, N}, Data),
 1031:                                 persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, N-1}),
 1032:                                 node_container_refc_check(node()),
 1033:                                 Data = persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N}),
 1034:                                 try
 1035:                                     persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N-1})
 1036:                                 catch
 1037:                                     error:badarg ->
 1038:                                         ok
 1039:                                 end,
 1040:                                 case N rem 4 of
 1041:                                     0 -> [persistent_term:get({?MODULE, N})|Acc];
 1042:                                     _ -> Acc
 1043:                                 end
 1044:                         end,
 1045:                         [],
 1046:                         lists:seq(1, 100)),
 1047:     persistent_term:erase({?MODULE, 100}),
 1048:     receive after 2000 -> ok end, %% give literal gc some time to run...
 1049:     node_container_refc_check(node()),
 1050:     id(Stuff),
 1051:     ok.
 1052: 
 1053: 
 1054: lost_pending_connection(Node) ->
 1055:     _ = (catch erts_internal:new_connection(Node)),
 1056:     ok.
 1057: 
 1058: dist_entry_gc(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1059:     Me = self(),
 1060:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(["+zdntgc", "0"]),
 1061:     P = spawn_link(Node,
 1062:                    fun () ->
 1063:                            LostNode = list_to_atom("lost_pending_connection@" ++ hostname()),
 1064:                            lost_pending_connection(LostNode),
 1065:                            garbage_collect(), %% Could crash...
 1066:                            Me ! {self(), ok}
 1067:                    end),
 1068:     receive
 1069:         {P, ok} -> ok
 1070:     end,
 1071:     unlink(P),
 1072:     stop_node(Peer, Node),
 1073:     ok.
 1074: 
 1075: huge_ref(Config) when is_list(Config) ->
 1076:     {ok, Peer, Node} = ?CT_PEER(),
 1077:     HRef = mk_ref({Node, 4711}, [4711, 705676, 3456, 1000000, 3456]),
 1078:     io:format("HRef=~p~n", [HRef]),
 1079:     HRef = binary_to_term(term_to_binary(HRef)),
 1080:     HRef = erpc:call(Node, fun () -> HRef end),
 1081:     peer:stop(Peer),
 1082:     ok.
 1083: 
 1084: %%
 1085: %% -- Internal utils ---------------------------------------------------------
 1086: %%
 1087: 
 1088: id(X) ->
 1089:     X.
 1090: 
 1091: -define(ND_REFS, erts_debug:get_internal_state(node_and_dist_references)).
 1092: 
 1093: node_container_refc_check(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1094:     AIS = erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(true),
 1095:     nc_refc_check(Node),
 1096:     erts_test_utils:available_internal_state(AIS).
 1097: 
 1098: nc_refc_check(Node) when is_atom(Node) ->
 1099:     Ref = make_ref(),
 1100:     Self = self(),
 1101:     io:format("Starting reference count check of node ~w~n", [Node]),
 1102:     Pid = spawn_link(
 1103:             Node,
 1104:             fun () ->
 1105:                     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(
 1106:                       fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1107:                               Self ! {Ref, ErrMsg, failed},
 1108:                               exit(normal)
 1109:                       end),
 1110:                     Self ! {Ref, succeeded}
 1111:             end),
 1112:     receive
 1113:         {Ref, ErrorMsg, failed} ->
 1114:             io:format("~s~n", [ErrorMsg]),
 1115:             ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed);
 1116:         {Ref, succeeded} ->
 1117:             io:format("Reference count check of node ~w succeeded!~n", [Node]),
 1118:             unlink(Pid),
 1119:             ok
 1120:     end.
 1121: 
 1122: get_node_references({NodeName, Creation} = Node) when is_atom(NodeName),
 1123:                                                       is_integer(Creation) ->
 1124:     {{node_references, NodeRefs},
 1125:      {dist_references, DistRefs}} = ?ND_REFS,
 1126:     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(
 1127:       fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1128:               io:format("~s", [ErrMsg]),
 1129:               ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed)
 1130:       end,
 1131:       NodeRefs, DistRefs),
 1132:     find_references(Node, NodeRefs).
 1133: 
 1134: get_dist_references(NodeName) when is_atom(NodeName) ->
 1135:     {{node_references, NodeRefs},
 1136:      {dist_references, DistRefs}} = ?ND_REFS,
 1137:     erts_test_utils:check_node_dist(fun (ErrMsg) ->
 1138:                                             io:format("~s", [ErrMsg]),
 1139:                                             ct:fail(reference_count_check_failed)
 1140:                                     end,
 1141:                                     NodeRefs, DistRefs),
 1142:     find_references(NodeName, DistRefs).
 1143: 
 1144: find_references(N, NRefList) ->
 1145:     case lists:keysearch(N, 1, NRefList) of
 1146:         {value, {N, _, ReferrersList}} -> ReferrersList;
 1147:         _ -> false
 1148:     end.
 1149: 
 1150: %% Currently unused
 1151: % refering_entity_type(RefererType, ReferingEntities) ->
 1152: %     lists:filter(fun ({{RT, _}, _}) when RT == RefererType ->
 1153: % 			 true;
 1154: % 		     (_) ->
 1155: % 			 false
 1156: % 		 end,
 1157: % 		 ReferingEntities).
 1158: 
 1159: refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, [{ReferingEntityId,_} = ReferingEntity
 1160:                                       | _ReferingEntities]) ->
 1161:     ReferingEntity;
 1162: refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, [_ | ReferingEntities]) ->
 1163:     refering_entity_id(ReferingEntityId, ReferingEntities);
 1164: refering_entity_id(_, []) ->
 1165:     false.
 1166: 
 1167: reference_type_count(_, false) ->
 1168:     0;
 1169: reference_type_count(Type, {_, _ReferenceCountList} = ReferingEntity) ->
 1170:     reference_type_count(Type, [ReferingEntity]);
 1171: reference_type_count(Type, ReferingEntities) when is_list(ReferingEntities) ->
 1172:     lists:foldl(fun ({_, ReferenceCountList}, Acc1) ->
 1173:                         lists:foldl(fun ({T, N}, Acc2) when T == Type ->
 1174:                                             N + Acc2;
 1175:                                         (_, Acc2) ->
 1176:                                             Acc2
 1177:                                     end,
 1178:                                     Acc1,
 1179:                                     ReferenceCountList)
 1180:                 end,
 1181:                 0,
 1182:                 ReferingEntities).
 1183: 
 1184: stop_node(Peer, Node) ->
 1185:     nc_refc_check(Node),
 1186:     peer:stop(Peer).
 1187: 
 1188: hostname() ->
 1189:     from($@, atom_to_list(node())).
 1190: 
 1191: from(H, [H | T]) -> T;
 1192: from(H, [_ | T]) -> from(H, T);
 1193: from(_H, []) -> [].
 1194: 
 1195: wait_until(Pred) ->
 1196:     case Pred() of
 1197:         true -> ok;
 1198:         false -> receive after 100 -> wait_until(Pred) end
 1199:     end.
 1200: 
 1201: get_nodefirstname_string() ->
 1202:     atom_to_list(?MODULE)
 1203:     ++ "-"
 1204:     ++ integer_to_list(erlang:system_time(second))
 1205:     ++ "-"
 1206:     ++ integer_to_list(erlang:unique_integer([positive])).
 1207: 
 1208: get_nodename() ->
 1209:     list_to_atom(get_nodefirstname_string()
 1210:                  ++ "@"
 1211:                  ++ hostname()).
 1212: 
 1213: mk_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial) ->
 1214:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_pid({NodeName, Creation}, Number, Serial).
 1215: 
 1216: mk_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number) ->
 1217:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_port({NodeName, Creation}, Number).
 1218: 
 1219: mk_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers) ->
 1220:     erts_test_utils:mk_ext_ref({NodeName, Creation}, Numbers).
 1221: 
 1222: 
 1223: exec_loop() ->
 1224:     receive
 1225:         {exec_fun, Fun} when is_function(Fun) ->
 1226:             Fun();
 1227:         {sync_exec_fun, From, Fun} when is_pid(From), is_function(Fun)  ->
 1228:             From ! {sync_exec_fun_res, self(), Fun()}
 1229:     end,
 1230:     exec_loop().
 1231: 
 1232: spawn_execer(Node) ->
 1233:     spawn(Node, fun () -> exec_loop() end).
 1234: 
 1235: spawn_link_execer(Node) ->
 1236:     spawn_link(Node, fun () -> exec_loop() end).
 1237: 
 1238: exec(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid), is_function(Fun) ->
 1239:     Pid ! {exec_fun, Fun}.
 1240: 
 1241: sync_exec(Pid, Fun) when is_pid(Pid), is_function(Fun) ->
 1242:     Pid ! {sync_exec_fun, self(), Fun},
 1243:     receive
 1244:         {sync_exec_fun_res, Pid, Res} ->
 1245:             Res
 1246:     end.
